trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of objects that can be individually accessed by index.

The <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> generic interface is a descendant of the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601> generic interface and is the base interface of all generic lists.
The type of elements in the list.
Determines the index of a specific item in the <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref>.
If an object occurs multiple times in the list, the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601.IndexOf%2A> method always returns the first instance found.
The object to locate in the <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref>.
The index of item if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
Inserts an item to the <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> at the specified index.
If `index` equals the number of items in the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>, then `item` is appended to the list.
In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element.
If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated.
This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table.
The zero-based index at which item should be inserted.
The object to insert into the <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref>.
index is not a valid index in the .
The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> is read-only.
Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[index]`.
The C# language uses the keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601.Item%2A> property.
Visual Basic implements <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601.Item%2A> as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The element at the specified index.
index is not a valid index in the .
The property is set and the <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> is read-only.
Removes the <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> item at the specified index.
In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot.
If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated.
This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
index is not a valid index in the .
The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> is read-only.
